title: The Gunfighters
dialogue_triumphs: Doctor (in the dentist's chair): 'I never touch alcohol.' Holliday (taking a swig): 'Well, I do.'
Steven (on being forced to find a tune to play): 'Let's hope the piano knows it.'
The Ballad, played all through the story, giddily starts to narrate it: 'So pick him up gentle/ And carry him so/ He's gone kind of mental/ From Earp's heavy blow.'
'He gave me a gun, he extracted my tooth… What more do you want?'
goofs: Episodes one and two have the world's quietest gunshots
In episode four's climactic gunfight Earp and Masterson apparently walk through a withering barrage of fire unscathed
In the ballad, 'earning your gunfighter's wings' is anachronistic, the phrase being coined in WWI
Shane Rimmer asks: 'You don't know where Holliday… You never met Holliday either?'
The Clanton gang have amazing accents, Billy having obviously been to finishing school, and Johnny Ringo to the RSC
Hartnell's reply to 'Goodbye and good luck' is 'The same to you and many of them!'
In episode three, when asked where Steven is, Hartnell replies: 'She's gone off with a gentleman called Johnny Ringo.'

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: The First Doctor, played by William Hartnell
continuity_notes.current_status: Can get toothache and tonsillitis, keeps a gun collection in the TARDIS, never touches alcohol, preferring milk

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time machine and spacecraft

continuity_notes.name: Steven Taylor
continuity_notes.current_status: Always wanted to be a cowboy, poor singer

continuity_notes.name: Dodo Dupont
continuity_notes.current_status: Can play piano a little better than Steven can sing

roots: Westerns, particularly High Noon and Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
Kate's performance is very Mae West

locations.name: Tombstone
locations.description: Town in the American Old West, site of the famous Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
locations.current_status: Setting for the episode, a few days leading up to 26 October 1881

additional_notes: The Doctor is named Deputy Sheriff of Tombstone. The given aliases for the party are Miss Dodo Dupont, Steven Regret, and Dr Caligari [from the owner of the magical cabinet]. Steven's cowboy outfit is described as 'OTT' (over the top).
bottom_line: With Hartnell, Purves and Anthony Jacobs in amazing form, and such a great script, this is a comic masterpiece, winning you over with its sheer charm.
